page.title: 10THE RAILWAY
page.content: THE RAILWAY WAS BUILT IN ABOUT 1850 BY THE MANCHESTER SHEFFIELD AND LINCOLN RAILWAY COMPANY. IT WAS LATER TAKEN OVER BY THE GREAT CENTRAL RAILWAY AND IN 1923 BECAME PART OF THE LONDON AND NORTH EASTERN RAILWAY.IT BECAME PART OF BRITISH RAILWAYS IN 1948. THERE USED TO BE A RAILWAY STATION AT CHEQUER HOUSE BUT THIS WAS CLOSED IN 1935 (PASSENGER SIDE) THE GOODS SIDE CONTINUED TO HANDLE LOCALLY GROWN POTATOES SUGAR BEET AND GRAIN UNTIL THE EARLY 1950'S. IN 1958 THE LEVEL CROSSING AT CHEQUER HOUSE WAS REPLACED BY A NEW FLY OVER AS PART OF THE RETFORD BY PASS. THE LINE IS MAINLY USED FOR COAL FROM YORKSHIRE EN ROUTE FOR THE TRENT VALLEY POWER STATIONS. EACH TRAIN IS 34 WAGONS EACH CARRYING 30 TONS OF COAL. APPROXIMATELY 40 FULL AND FORTY EMPTY WAGONS PLY UP AND DOWN DAILY.
